summary:
Tonga, officially the Kingdom of Tonga, is a Polynesian island country in Oceania with 171 islands, 45 of which are inhabited. It covers about 750 square kilometers but is scattered over 700,000 square kilometers in the Pacific Ocean. As of 2021, it has a population of around 104,000, with most living on the main island, Tongatapu.

First settled around 2,500 years ago by the Lapita people, Tonga grew into a powerful regional empire, known as the Tu ªi Tonga Empire. It was a major force in the Pacific until the 13th century. From 1900 to 1970, Tonga was a British protected state but retained its sovereignty. In 2010, it transitioned from an absolute monarchy to a semi-constitutional one.
